channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sanofi’s chief digital officer says remote work means employees lose the ‘serendipity’ needed to innovate
item.description: "I think we were contrarians,” Sanofi's chief digital officer Emmanuel Frenehard told Fortune. “I think the contrarians are becoming the norm.”

item.title: How Black Friday transformed from chaotic mall mobs to a month of deals—and the surprising reason it’s not all about the internet
item.description: The annual sales event no longer creates the midnight mall crowds or doorbuster mayhem of recent decades. Here's why:

item.title: Los Angeles oil field owner sues California over law that would require it to stop production and plug its wells
item.description: Inglewood Oil Field owner Sentinel Peak argues in the lawsuit, filed this week, that the law, which was signed in September by Gov. Gavin Newsom, is u...

item.title: Russian central bank takes desperate stand to halt collapsing ruble and fierce inflation
item.description: Worth a fraction of a penny now, the ruble has fallen to lows not seen since March 2022 in the early days of the war against Ukraine.

item.title: Keira Knightley, who got an agent at 6, says her daughters will focus on academics, not acting: ‘You need those pieces of paper saying you’re smart’
item.description: 'Pirates of the Caribbean' star Kiera Knightley said she wished she had done an Open University course after starring in 'Bend It Like Beckham.'
